unnormalised: ## New Wheels are Here, Yaar! All the Latest Vehicle Launches You Need to Know!
normalised: new wheels are here, yaar! all the latest vehicle launches you need to know!

unnormalised: Hey guys, buckle up! The Indian automotive scene is hotter than a Chennai summer right now, with manufacturers dropping new models left, right, and center. We’re talking everything from budget-friendly hatchbacks to luxurious SUVs that’ll make you feel like royalty.
normalised: hey guys, buckle up! the indian automotive scene is hotter than a chennai summer right now, with manufacturers dropping new models left, right, and center. we are talking everything from budget-friendly hatchbacks to luxurious S U V’s that will make you feel like royalty.

unnormalised: First up, Tata Motors finally launched the new Punch EV! They were teasing this thing for ages, and it’s finally here. Early reviews suggest it's a solid contender in the electric micro-SUV segment. Think you can manage the Bangalore traffic in this baby?
normalised: first up, tata motors finally launched the new punch E V! they were teasing this thing for ages, and it is finally here. early reviews suggest it is a solid contender in the electric micro-S U V segment. think you can manage the bangalore traffic in this baby?

unnormalised: Then there's Mahindra, who just unleashed a special edition Thar. This one comes with all the bells and whistles – extra ground clearance, new tires, and a spiffy interior. Perfect for those weekend getaways to the Himalayas, right? Expect to shell out around Rs. 15 Lakh for the top model, though.
normalised: then there is mahindra, who just unleashed a special edition thar. this one comes with all the bells and whistles – extra ground clearance, new tires, and a spiffy interior. perfect for those weekend getaways to the himalayas, right? expect to shell out around rupee fifteen lakh for the top model, though.

unnormalised: Moving onto the premium segment, BMW just dropped the facelifted X5. It’s got a bigger touchscreen, updated engine options, and a design that's sharper than ever. Of course, it comes with a price tag to match.
normalised: moving onto the premium segment, B M W just dropped the facelifted X five. it has got a bigger touchscreen, updated engine options, and a design that is sharper than ever. of course, it comes with a price tag to match.

unnormalised: And let's not forget Maruti Suzuki, the kings of the Indian market. They've finally revamped the Alto 800 with a fresh look and claimed improved fuel efficiency. Great for navigating those crowded Delhi lanes! We're hearing rumours of a CNG version hitting the streets soon too.
normalised: and let us not forget maruti suzuki, the kings of the indian market. they have finally revamped the alto eight hundred with a fresh look and claimed improved fuel efficiency. great for navigating those crowded delhi lanes! we are hearing rumours of a C N G version hitting the streets soon too.

unnormalised: Hyundai is also playing strong. Their Creta facelift, spotted testing near Pune, is anticipated to be launched before Diwali. The interiors look spacious and the dash looks cutting edge. We're expecting a massive fight in the mid-size SUV segment.
normalised: hyundai is also playing strong. their creta facelift, spotted testing near pune, is anticipated to be launched before diwali. the interiors look spacious and the dash looks cutting edge. we are expecting a massive fight in the mid-size S U V segment.

unnormalised: Dr. Sharma at IIT Delhi says the future of automotive engineering is in hybrid technology. He might be right.
normalised: doctor sharma at I I T delhi says the future of automotive engineering is in hybrid technology. he might be right.

unnormalised: And hey, remember that crazy concept car showcased at the Auto Expo? Well, apparently, it's inching closer to reality! We’re talking about the potential for a homegrown electric sports car, built completely in India with a range of 500 km! With floor space measuring over 10,000 sq ft, the production factory in Gujarat seems geared up for the launch. Exciting times ahead, folks!
normalised: and hey, remember that crazy concept car showcased at the auto expo? well, apparently, it is inching closer to reality! we are talking about the potential for a homegrown electric sports car, built completely in india with a range of five hundred kilometer! with floor space measuring over ten thousand square feet, the production factory in gujarat seems geared up for the launch. exciting times ahead, folks!
